definition: (of a ghost) to make strange things happen/to act up/to act behind the scenes/to make mischief/odd/to misbehave (euphemism for having sex)
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
bewildering/odd/strange/uncanny/devil/monster/to wonder at/to blame/quite/rather
variant of 怪[guai4]
lit. to summon demons to create havoc (idiom)/fig. to stir up all kinds of trouble
ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)

sentences.english: After all, this is male chauvinism at play in.
sentences.chinese: 说到底，这也是大男人主义在作怪了。

sentences.english: This is actually a little adventure coral Taro heart trouble.
sentences.chinese: 这其实是瑚太朗的小小冒险心在作怪。

sentences.english: Is it any wonder they embrace a weirdness that baffles their elders?
sentences.chinese: 难怪他们作怪不断，隔开了长辈。

sentences.english: As a result of orthodoxy, then all the history of the old China of an extremely brief period of writing.
sentences.chinese: 由于正统观念作怪，旧中国史将这一段写的极其简略。

sentences.english: But there is also the spectre of political risk.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有政治风险在作怪。

sentences.english: The organization has been destroyed by undesirable elements.
sentences.chinese: 组织已给不良分子作怪了。

sentences.english: And there are other, less tangible factors.
sentences.chinese: 另外还有一些无形的因素在作怪。

sentences.english: He was suggesting the reason was racism.
sentences.chinese: 盛田昭夫认为这是种族主义偏见在作怪。

sentences.english: Whether that’s true or not, that’s cognitive dissonance in action.
sentences.chinese: 不管那是对或错，都是认知失调在作怪。

sentences.english: Treasure grandpa will be counted a ghost, ask her to see yet?
sentences.chinese: 宝爷爷就做鬼作怪，问她看到了没有？

bastard/scoundrel/rogue
